long_desc.thetext:
It's currently pretty hard to find a particular project's charter.
Although most projects just use the standard charter, it would be good if that charter were accessible from the project info page that's generated from the project metadata.
See slots at http://www.eclipse.org/projects/dev_process/project-status-infrastructure.php missing a slot for the charter.

Only top-level projects have a charter [1].
We'd need to capture this information in the portal. Do we need to restrict this metadata option from subprojects? Is it possible with the current implementation to have top-level only metadata?
With the information captured at the top-level, it should be pretty easy to put it on the Project Summary Pages.
[1] http://www.eclipse.org/projects/dev_process/development_process.php#4_5_Scope

Moving to Portal. For top level projects, we should capture the charterURL; then we can display that information in the corresponding project summary page.
Do you believe that other projects should provide a reference to their top-level project's charter in the project summary? I'm inclined toward "no".
We should also display the charter in the leftnav of top level project's website. I think we can do that, right?

Let's move the charter into the new project management infrastructure. Rather than include it simply as a link, we should just move the charter into the new infrastructure as a managed document of some form.

Projects support labeled links to arbitrary content. I've leveraged this to represent a "Top Level Project Charter".
I've added links to the charter for each top level project. For Technology, I moved the charter into a Drupal document. Other top level projects can do this when/if they choose.
Marked as FIXED.
